Pre-Game Insights: Andrew Miller suggests that the visitors will have more focus on the matter at hand.
Jason Roy seems to have his game brain in gear, to judge by his blistering 36-ball hundred in England's warm-up match.
West Indies' campaign culminated in four defeats out of five, the exception being a gutsy defence against Bangladesh.
Five years on from their thrilling triumph over England in the 2016 final, an ageing outfit finally hit the buffers with a clang.

West Indies' once-radical policy of sacking off singles in favour of six-hitting came a cropper, and the rematch in Dubai was anything but, as Moeen Ali and Adil Rashid combined to rout their opponents for 55.
With only ten months to go until yet another T20 World Cup in Australia, it's time to mould a new team fit to lace their forebears' Champion-dancing shoes.
Phil Simmons' concerns about the quality of young batters in the Caribbean rather echoed the existential concerns about county cricket's next generation of Test performers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This will be the first time that Barbados has hosted international cricket since becoming a republic, in November last year.
England have won four and lost two of their six previous T20Is in Barbados, although their record against West Indies at the venue is played three, lost two.
Both of those defeats came in the 2-1 series loss in March 2014, which is perhaps best remembered for the broken wrist that Ben Stokes sustained after punching his locker door.
In better Barbados memories, Bridgetown is also the venue for England's World T20 final victory over Australia in 2010, their first piece of global silverware.
Others: Kieron Pollard and Eoin Morgan at the toss in the T20 World Cup
Phil Salt admitted to ESPNcricinfo this week that he had been underwhelmed by his England debut in Cardiff last year
Nicholas Pooran's time is now, the West Indies batter averages 23.47 in 49 T20Is, at a strike-rate of 128.03 that doesn't quite reflect his pre-eminence either
Kyle Mayers opened ahead of Shai Hope in West Indies' practice match and may get the nod to partner Brandon King
Liam Livingstone missed England's warm-up game with a mild illness and will sit out the opening T20I as a precaution
Sam Billings, Tom Banton, and Phil Salt are competing over the gloves
England opted for a batting-heavy strategy in the T20 World Cup but may consider fielding an additional seamer, or the extra spin of Liam Dawson
